name: biomni-analyze-bacterial-growth-curve
title: Biomni: Analyze Bacterial Growth Curve
description: Analyze bacterial growth curve data to determine growth parameters including doubling time and lag phase
content:
Overview

Analyze bacterial growth curve data from optical density (OD) measurements to determine key growth parameters including doubling time, lag phase duration, exponential growth rate, and maximum culture density. This tool fits experimental data to bacterial growth models and extracts biologically meaningful kinetic parameters.

Input Parameters

  • time_points (list of numbers, required): Array of time measurements in hours or minutes corresponding to each OD reading
  • od_values (list of numbers, required): Array of optical density measurements (typically at 600nm) at each time point
  • strain_name (string, required): Name or identifier of the bacterial strain being analyzed

Biological Use Case

Critical for immunology research involving host-pathogen interactions and microbiome studies. Applications include: (1) Characterizing growth kinetics of pathogenic bacteria under immune pressure, (2) Evaluating antimicrobial peptide effects on bacterial growth, (3) Comparing growth rates of commensal vs. pathogenic strains, (4) Assessing bacterial fitness after phagocyte exposure, and (5) Studying bacterial competition dynamics in the gut microbiome that influence mucosal immunity.

Output

Provides comprehensive growth analysis including: calculated doubling time (generation time), lag phase duration, maximum specific growth rate (μmax), carrying capacity (maximum OD), goodness-of-fit statistics (R-squared), and growth curve parameters. Results include a text summary saved to 'growth_curve_results.txt' with all calculated metrics.

Category

immunology
